In addition to the stigmatization related to the notion of sin, a Christian believer who is a non-heterosexual porn addict may also face the condemnation of their sexual orientation by their religious community. Many conservative Christian denominations view non-heterosexual behavior as sinful and immoral, which can exacerbate the shame and guilt that a non-heterosexual porn addict may already be experiencing. This can lead to internalized homophobia, where the individual develops negative feelings towards their own sexual orientation, and may make it even more difficult for them to seek help or support for their porn addiction.

Moreover, in some conservative Christian communities, there may be a lack of understanding or awareness about non-heterosexual porn addiction, which can lead to further isolation and stigma for those who are struggling with it. This can also lead to a lack of resources or support specifically tailored to non-heterosexual porn addiction recovery.

Overall, the intersection of conservative Christian beliefs and non-heterosexual porn addiction can lead to increased stigmatization and barriers to seeking help and support.
